title: the powers conferred on me by section 3 of the European Communities Act
heading: 1. These Regulations may be cited as the European Communities
text_raw:
1. These Regulations may be cited as the European Communities 
(Marketing of Vegetable Propagating and Plant Material, other than Seed) 
(Amendment) Regulations 2020.
text_norm: 1 regulation may cited european community (marketing vegetable propagating plant material seed) (amendment) regulation 2020

title: the powers conferred on me by section 3 of the European Communities Act
heading: 2. The European Communities
text_raw:
2. The European Communities 

(Amendment) 
Regulations 2014 (S.I. No. 152 of 2014) are amended in Regulation 2(1) by 
substituting for the definition of “Directive”, the following – 

(Vegetable Seeds) 

as 

amended by Commission 

“‘Directive’ means Council Directive No. 2008/72/EC of 15th July 
20082 
Implementing Decision 
2013/166/EU of 2 April 20133, Commission Implementing Directive 
2013/45/EU of 7th August 20134 and Commission Implementing 
Directive (EU) 2019/990 of 17 June 2019.”; 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

26 February, 2020. 

MICHAEL CREED, 

Minister for Agriculture, Food and the Marine. 

1 OJ L 160, 18.06.2019 P. 14 
2 OJ L205, 01.08.2008 P.28 
3 OJ L94, 04.04.2013, P.8 
4 OJ L213 08.08.0203, p.20 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 3rd March, 2020. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [59] 3

title: the powers conferred on me by section 3 of the European Communities Act
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

These Regulations give effect to the provisions of Commission Implementing 
Directive (EU) 2019/990 as they apply to Council Directive 2008/72/EC on the 
marketing of vegetable propagating and planting material, other than seed by 
updating the listing of scientific name of the species contained in Annex I and 
Annex II. 

 
 
 
 
 
 4 [59]
